p: The scientific appraisal of the pharmacological activities of herbal plants revealed about 200,000 phytochemicals. These compounds contribute to the apparent medicinal activities displayed by plants and invariably justify the involvement of natural products in the development of novel drugs [ 5]. Despite these achievements, the use of herbal drugs was not universally accepted in contemporary medicine due to lack of scientific evidence and proper documentation. However, the significance of herbs in pharmacology has necessitated the provision of scientific facts on bioactive compounds and pharmacological assays of plants [ 6, 7].
